fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to create a Software Project Space in Confluence to link to a Jira Project, users are unable to select a project in the modal.
h3. Environment
Encountered on the following versions:
* Confluence 6.7.0
* Jira 7.4.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and Jira
# Go to *Spaces* > *Create Space*
# Select “Software Project Space” and click *Next*


h3. Expected Results
On this screen, you should be able to select a Jira project from the Dropdown to complete the configuration. 

h3. Actual Results
You’re unable to click the *Jira Servers* dropdown (if you have multiple Jira instances connected) and if you have a single Jira instance connected, you cannot select the *Project* dropdown. No projects or Jira servers are listed in the dropdowns when they are clicked. Please see screenshot below: 
!software_project.png|thumbnail!
 

h3.Workaround
There is no current workaround.
fields.summary: Cannot create Software Project Space

fields.description:
Freely flowing text becomes harder to read as the width of the browser increases.  I want to limit how much a section on a page can grow in width.

I want to specify a maximum width for sections, and have those sections center justified in the browser window.  If the browser window width is shorter that the maximum width specified for the section, the section must honor the browser width.

There may be diagrams on the page that may need to be wider.  These can be put in a section of their own, and that section allowed to match the width of the browser at all times, i.e. maximum_width set to 'ANY'.

I am not referring to Section & Column macros here.  I am referring to the page layout tool and the sections that can be added with it.

I was able to achieve the maximum width setting using HTML macro by using {{<style>}}, and setting it for {{.columnMacro.conf-macro.output-block}}, {{.cell.normal.innerCell}}, and {{.columnLayout.single}}.  But it is just a hack.  A Confluence native solution is desirable.

Using stylesheets is not an option for me because creating a new space to apply it is not something I decide or control in my company. I can only control individual pages. In fact, my company has actively refused to create separate spaces for projects for various reasons.
fields.summary: Maximum width for sections on a page

fields.description:
*SUMMARY*

If a page which has a title containing a colon has an excerpt macro, the corresponding excerpt-include page can "forget" the Space that contains the excerpt macro.

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a page with a colon in the title, such as "Excerpt: testing" and add an excerpt macro which contains some content.
 # Create another page in the same Space and add an excerpt-include macro and select the "Excerpt: testing" page created in step one.
 # Create another page in the same Space and add an excerpt macro which contains some content.
 # Add a new excerpt-include macro to the same page created in step 2 which references the excerpt macro created in step 3.
 # Edit the title for the page created in step 3 so that it is different in some way.
 # Go to the page which contains the two excerpt-include macros which was created in step 2, and click Edit and then Save.
 # Observe that the excerpt-include macro for the page which contains the colon in the title is now broken. If you click edit, you will see that the Space name that had been present is now missing.

*Observations*

I noticed that when you add an excerpt-include macro which references a page with a colon in the title that the Space key is always automatically added even when the page with the excerpt macro is in the same Space. When you add a page in the same Space whose title does not contain a colon, the Space key is not automatically included.
fields.summary: Excerpt-include macro loses Space name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user wants to share a Confluence page to a group, the user needs to know the exact name of the group/user. Currently, there are no preview of all available groups/user and the search feature for the groups/user is not smart enough to detect the full group/user name if the user input is a substring of the name. 

For example: In a Confluence instance with the following groups: hr group, finance group. If a user types "group" in the Add People field of the search dialog, Confluence will not retrieve the above groups as options the user can choose from. The user must start his search with "finance" in order for Confluence to retrieve finance group as one of the options.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Given a Confluence instance that has the following groups: finance group, hr group
** Navigate to a page and then click "Share"
** In the panel, under Add People, type group

 !Screen Shot 2018-06-12 at 10.16.49 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Confluence will give a list of all groups that has the text "group" in it. 

h3. Actual Results
Confluence does not retrieve any group. 

h5. Improvement Suggestions:
# Make group search "smart" enough to be able to retrieve all groups that has a particular sub-string from the search parameter.
# Display all groups in the dropdown for easy access.
fields.summary: Search in the Add People option usability improvements
Support for SQL servers 2012

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the introduction of Synchrony for Collaborative Editing in Confluence 6.x, Confluence datacenter requires the setup of a separate Synchrony cluster for this feature to work. This requires separate JVMs to monitor. 
If you have Dynatrace configured and you're monitoring the traffic to those nodes, you might want to do the same for Synchrony. At the moment, there is no clear direction on how to profile the Synchrony nodes traffic

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good if there is a documentation or set of instructions on how/what to profile in order to capture the traffic to the Synchrony nodes
fields.summary: How to monitor Synchrony traffic using Dynatrace

fields.description:
Creating and publishing a page from a unpublished page will result in that page not having proper parent.

Side effects of this are:
- Page information page will display that page parent name is $webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle) 
- Page parent will not be visible in sidebar. Witch is expected as page is not published.

It would be beneficial to make a check on publishing of a page to see if the parent is a draft or a page. In a case where parent page is a draft, warning should be displayed, that parent is not published.
fields.summary: Improve page publishing process with a warning message.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When placing an anchor within an Expand Macro, the anchor will not lead to the correct location of the page. It will stay at the top of said page

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a page
# Insert and Expand Macro
# Place an anchor inside of said macro
# Publish page
# Go to another page
# Create link to previous anchor
# Publish page
# Click link to anchor

h3. Expected results

- The link correctly redirects the user to said position in page

h3. Actual results

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Confluence is connected to Delegated LDAP, users that are already deleted from LDAP side will not be able to be disabled from Confluence

h3. Environment
* Delegated (Internal with LDAP Authentication) LDAP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Confluence to an LDAP with Delagated permission
# Login to Confluence as one of the user from the Delegated LDAP
# Create some content in Confluence
# Logout
# Remove this user from LDAP side
# Disable the user in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
# User able to be disabled in Confluence

h3. Actual Results
User unable to be disabled from Confluence. The following error message appears:
{code}
User "UserA" could not be disabled. The directory may be read-only.
{code}

Even if we recreate the user from LDAP, we'll still unable to disable the user in Confluence side.

h3.Workaround
Disable the user manually by running the following database SQL query:
{code}
UPDATE cwd_user SET active = 'F' where user_name = '<the username that we'd like to disable>';
{code}
(!) Please always backup your database before performing any alteration in the database side.
fields.summary: Unable to disable users from Delegated LDAP when the users are removed from LDAP side

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When updating an event which has invitee, it will cause duplication on invitee in the database. If we still keep updating that event, it will cause OOME on Confluence when viewing the Calendar.

h3. Environment
* Version 5.5.0 of TC and above

h3. Diagnosis
This SQL query will return the duplicates
{code:sql|title=PostgreSQL}
select "EVENT_ID", "INVITEE_ID", count(*) from "AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES" group by "EVENT_ID", "INVITEE_ID";
{code}
{code:sql|title=MySQL}
select EVENT_ID, INVITEE_ID, count(*) from AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES group by EVENT_ID, INVITEE_ID;
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar and an event
# Add one user to the event
# Add several more users to the event
# Delete the users

h3. Expected Results
There will be only one entry for each user in {{AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES}}.

h3. Actual Results
There are duplicates in {{AO_950DC3_TC_EVENTS_INVITEES}}. This will lead to {{java.lang.OutOfMemoryError}}. 
{code}
2018-06-06 16:07:08,425 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Java heap space
 -- referer: https://confluence.mycompany.com/ | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | traceId: cb4b89b5605bbaf1 | userName: admin
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Arrays.java:3332)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.ensureCapacityInternal(AbstractStringBuilder.java:124)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(AbstractStringBuilder.java:448)
	at java.lang.StringBuffer.append(StringBuffer.java:270)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.component.VEvent.toString(VEvent.java:325)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.toSubCalendarEvent(DefaultCalendarManager.java:851)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.ical4j.RecurrenceRuleProcessor.getRecurrenceEvents(RecurrenceRuleProcessor.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.getEvents(DefaultCalendarManager.java:715)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
Heap Dump analysis shows one thread with most memory
 !heapdump-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !dominator_tree-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Upgrade TC.
fields.summary: Updating Event causes duplicated invitee in database and java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
Jira's epic tab has a similar graph, but we want to see a percentage complete in Confluence for epics. (i.e. Profile Page - 56% complete)

The best I can do currently is to create a JQL filter based on the number of issues not resolved in an epic vs total issues in an epic, and then manually do the math. 

This is simple arithmetic, & I wish there was a way to show percentage complete for epics. We have our roadmaps and other filters in Confluence, & this functionality would make them stronger reporting tools for stakeholders.

 

There are two places 3 ways I could imagine this being implemented in Confluence working :
# In the Jira Issue/Filter macro under display settings 
# As its own macro

I've also added a suggestion as Show to where it could live in Jira: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67438
# Next to the 'Issues in Epic' label in Jira side of the
fields.summary: Epics - Display percentage complete to easily assess progress

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sometimes when using Edge, you can't upload files via the *browse for files* link. It is an intermittent issue but it can be reproduced.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Login in Confluence using Edge.
# Create a "File List" page using the default template or just insert an "Attachments" macro to a page.
# Click on the *browse for files* link and try to upload some files per time.

h3. Expected Results

All files will be attached properly after clicking on the "open" button from the Explorer window.

h3. Actual Results
The files are not attached in time. After selecting the attachment and clicking on the 'open' button, the file is not attached and the loading icon doesn't appear next to the *browse for files* link.

During the tests, I had to try to upload the same file three times in order to work. 

h3. Notes
Dragging and dropping working fine.

h3.Workaround
Drag and drop the attachment.
fields.summary: Browse for files not working as expected using Edge

fields.description:
h3. +Problem+

In [Running Confluence over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html], under *Step 2. Modify your Confluence server.xml file*, the example config uses {{sslProtocols}} incorrectly:
{code:java}
<Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
    maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"                    
    protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"
    enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
    acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
    clientAuth="false" sslProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2"      
       sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" SSLEnabled="true"
    URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="<MY_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD>"/>
{code}
(i) This attribute shouldn't accept multiple values.

(!) Configuring as above makes the Connector fail to start: [JIRA's Tomcat SSL Connector fails to start with SSLContext not available|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA%27s+Tomcat+SSL+Connector+fails+to+start+with+SSLContext+not+available].
h3. +Suggested Fix+

{{sslProtocols}} is not necessary and should be removed from the example. Using only {{sslEnabledProtocols}} is enough.
fields.summary: Documentation regarding configuring SSL uses wrong attribute in example config

fields.description:
Hi Team!

My name's Vadim Rutkevich and I'm a product owner of [Smart Attachments for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219123/smart-attachments-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] app.

It will be nice to have an extension point to filter attachments on the Confluence dashboard. So that we will have an option to block appearance of newly uploaded files on the dashboard.

*Use Cases*

Our new app works with Confluence attachments and store them in our folders (your pages). The problem is that a newly uploaded file is displayed on Confluence dashboard. The more files, the more spam on the dashboard.
fields.summary: Extension point to filter attachments on the Confluence dashboard

fields.description:
Hi Team!

My name's Vadim Rutkevich and I'm a product owner of [Smart Attachments for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219123/smart-attachments-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] app.

It will be nice to have an extension point to filter appearance of pages on the Confluence dashboard. So that we will have an option to block appearance of newly created pages (created by some third-party app) on the dashboard.

At the moment we are setting the old dates to pages, so they do not appear. But this is not convenient and is not good in general from the architecture perspective.

*Use Case*

We are using your native Confluence pages to render our own entities (folders) in the space storage for keeping documents and files. The problem is that a newly created page is displayed on Confluence dashboard. We would greatly appreciate if you could provide/implement some extension point to filter information about created pages on Confluence dashboard. So that we can use the native functionality instead of tricking Confluence with dates.
fields.summary: Extension point to filter information about created pages on Confluence dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently init scripts for LSB applications do not contain LSB dependency info, which means Confluence may attempt to start before or at the same time as its database backend. It fails to access its database, and therefore fails to start.

h3. Suggested Solution

For LSB applications, put all the supported databases under Should-Start instead of Required-Start. Then Confluence after whatever databases are installed on that host.
 
h3. Workaround

You can add a customized [LSB comment block|https://wiki.debian.org/LSBInitScripts].
fields.summary: Init scripts for lsb applications should have supported databases under Should-Start

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users access an old version of a page via the Page History Macro the old version is displayed. However the *Restore this Version* link on the top of that page does not work. Clicking on that link will redirect the user to the most recent version of the page.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Confluence page that has old versions.
# Click *Edit*
# Add a *Page History Macro* in the page and click *Update*. 
# A list of the versions of the page will be displayed in the page. 
# Access an old version of the page through one of the links in the list. This will redirect you to the old version.
#  In the top of the page you will see *Restore this Version*.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence will redirect the user to a page where he needs to confirm that he wants to restore the page to this old version.

h3. Actual Results
 Clicking on that link will redirect the user to the most recent version of the page.

h3.Workaround
From the Confluence page in question. Head over to the *...* > Page History > Click restore on the version of your choice.
fields.summary: Restore this Version option does not work when using Page History Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A WARN level event is logged every 5 min due to failed scheduled *LaasPerformanceLoggingJob* job.
The job is not required on the server version of Confluence and is used in Cloud. The job is failing because LaaS performance logging is turned off by default.
Warn is getting logged because scheduled job log level was raised as a result of CONFSERVER-54226 feature request.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{code:java}
2018-06-08 07:51:21,912 WARN [Caesium-1-1] [impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper] runJob Scheduled job LaasPerformanceLoggingJob#LaasPerformanceLoggingJob completed unsuccessfully with response JobRunnerResponse[runOutcome=ABORTED,message='LaaS performance logging is turned off']
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

The job should be removed or disabled on startup to avoid confusion, log spam and conserve resources allocated to running the job.
h3. Workaround

Disable the "scheduledjob.desc.LaasPerformanceLoggingJob" from  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png! > *General Configuration* > *Scheduled jobs*
fields.summary: LaasPerformanceLoggingJob log spam while LaaS performance logging is turned off by default
Upgrade Confluence to use Hazelcast 3.8.6

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence mentions do not find users if search term is preceded by punctuation in the display_name. (e.g. searching "Billy" for someone who has a display_name of "Mays,Billy" does not return any results). This is an issue in recent versions (6.8, 6.7), but did not happen in 6.4 or 6.2 (In these versions, "Mays,Billy" would come up in a mention search for "Billy"). This is an issue that appeared somewhere between 6.5 and 6.7.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with punctionation-separated strings in the display_name (e.g. "Mays,Billy")
# Do an @-mention search for "Billy"

h3. Expected Results
"Mays,Billy" will appear in search results.

h3. Actual Results
"Mays,Billy" does not appear in search results.

h3. Workaround
Search the user by their username or a string that is not preceded by punctuation in the display_name.
fields.summary: Confluence mentions do not find users if search term is preceded by punctuation in the display_name

fields.description:
When adding an excerpt macro, you have two choices for the formatting, inline, or new line. Regardless of the option you choose, when you use the excerpt-include macro, the excerpt is always inline. I can see that the storage format for the macro is updated properly to be BLOCK, when you choose new line, and INLINE, when you choose inline. However, the macro is always rendered inline.

 
h4. *Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a new page and insert an excerpt macro and choose the option for a new line, not inline.
 # Create another page and insert an excerpt-include macro pointing to the excerpt created above.
 # Save the page and observe that the excerpt is inline, not on a new line.
fields.summary: Excerpt macro new line option doesn't work when using excerpt-include macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When requiring an SSL connection between Synchrony and the AWS Elastic Load Balancer, the default configuration returns an Amazon SSL certificate instead of the customer's domain certificate. This can cause Synchrony to stop connecting.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Data Center deployed to AWS via template

h3. Workaround
* Manually edit /etc/atl file to change ATL_SYNCHRONY_SERVICE_URL to point to the customer's domain instead of the ELB FQDN

h3. Proposed Solution
* Change the Confluence Data Center template to set ATL_SYNCHRONY_SERVICE_URL to use ATL_PROXY_NAME instead of the LoadBalancerName
fields.summary: Change the Confluence Datacenter AWS Template to use customer's domain instead of the elastic load balancer domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence could have a built-in tool to scan the contents of pages and report potential inconsistencies in the storage format.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the Health Check section, add a scanning tool similar to the one below:
 * [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/archives/scanning-confluence-for-content-errors]

While this script is useful, it is quite old and is not reliable for finding problems with attachments references, for example. Also, it uses the deprecated APIs, so the built-in tool could rely on REST to check the content while having all features that this existing script provides.
h3. Why this is important

This would be very important for companies that rely on Confluence to release large document sets alongside their software releases. Since we don't have a scanning tool, the admins need to manually search for problems in order to fix them. This is not scalable and almost impossible based on the number of pages.
fields.summary: Provide a built-in tool to search for inconsistencies in Confluence contents

fields.description:
Hey,

My users expect to be able to save the work they've done so far without having to exit editing mode and creating a new revision.

While drafts are great for backup, only the latest version will be saved and is not necessarily the one the user wanted to be saved.

Thanks

fields.description:
"The old-Confluence behavior (non-synchrony) in the case when multiple people edit and save a page in parallel, is that the page is published as many times as there are people saving, but each publish is a consistent change. If either of the people wants to abandon their changes, they can do so easily by clicking on Cancel. However, in synchrony if one person makes a change (and haven't saved it yet), some other person can easily end up publishing the first person's changes, even if the first person eventually decides to scratch them.

In synchrony enabled confluence, can there be a way for users giving option to select the editing mode \{synchrony style or non synchrony style}, when user starts editing a page.
fields.summary: Synchrony shared draft issue

fields.description:
h3. Description
Confluence log analyzer does not capture error related to directories synchronization issue. When a user directory is failed to synchronize, the log analyzer does not capture the error.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Start JIRA and Create an application in JIRA user server
# Add the JIRA as a user directory in the confluence
# Perform the  synchronization to ensure the synchronization is working
# Locate back to JIRA user server page and edit the application created in step 1. Remove all the ip-address for the application and save it
# Locate back to confluence and perform the synchronization
# In the confluence log, it shows that the synchronization failed due to "403 - Forbidden" error and this error is not captured in the log analyzer.

Expected Result
The error is captured in the log analyzer.

Actual Result
The error is not captured in the logs analyzer
fields.summary: Log analyzer does not capture directory synchronization error.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Update [Run Confluence as a systemd service on linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/run-confluence-as-a-systemd-service-on-linux-937177781.html]. According to internal cases, customers have been facing issues to install Confluence as systemd service, and the workaround provided by Greg at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54291 has been resolving issues with.

{panel:title=Greg's steps}
1) Shutdown Confluence. Remove remnants of existing init.d confluence service (just in case, backup these files first)
{noformat}
sudo rm /etc/init.d/confluence 
sudo rm /etc/rc0.d/K01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc1.d/K01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc2.d/S01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc3.d/S01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc4.d/S01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc5.d/S01confluence
sudo rm /etc/rc6.d/K01confluence
{noformat}
Check if following file exists and if required remove it
{noformat}
sudo rm /run/systemd/generator.late/confluence.service
{noformat}

2) create  a systemd unit file:
{noformat}
sudo vi /etc/systemd/system/confluence.service
{noformat}

add following entries to the file:
{noformat}
[Unit]
Description=Confluence
After=network.target
[Service]
Type=forking
User=confluence
PIDFile=/opt/atlassian/confluence/work/catalina.pid
ExecStart=/opt/atlassian/confluence/bin/start-confluence.sh
ExecStop=/opt/atlassian/confluence/bin/stop-confluence.sh
[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
{noformat}
(!) edit paths to Confluence directory (by default "/opt/atlassian/confluence") and user which is used for starting confluence (default "confluence")

3) save and exit 
Reload the daemon and enable the newly created service:
{noformat}
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable confluence
sudo systemctl start confluence
{noformat}

then test if service  started without issues: 
{noformat}
sudo systemctl status confluence
{noformat}
{panel}
fields.summary: Update documentation to run Confluence as systemd

Constraint {{fkwjyn6091q3l1gl7bh143ma2a}} is the one linking the {{pageid}} column in the content table to the {{contentid}} column in the same table. So I assume that Confluence is trying to delete the page before deleting the JsonContentProperty. As JsonContentProperties are stored as custom content, I assume the issue appears with other types of custom content as well. I can reproduce the issue with Confluence 6.0 until 6.7 (didn't test any other versions).

Deleting the JsonContentProperty makes it possible to delete the page again.

One strange discovery that I made is that the issue doesn't come up if I run {{pageManager.deepCopyPage()}} with the page (without copying content properties) after creating the content property. I haven't been able to narrow down why this is, but I assume it is somehow connected to the transaction magic that is happening there.
fields.summary: Cannot delete pages/spaces containing JsonContentProperties

fields.description:
h3. Description
When the user copy and paste the square bullet list to confluence page, the bullet list will change from square bullet list to circle bullet list

*Step to reproduce*
# Create a Confluence page
# add a square bullet list (press "-" and space)
# Copy the bullet list
# paste it on the same page.

Expected Result
the bullet list will remain square

Actual Result
the bullet list is changed to circle bullet list
fields.summary: When copy and paste a squre bullet list, it will changed to circle bullet list

fields.description:
h5. Summary

When following the steps to restore from an RDS snapshot (from here: [Confluence Data Center on AWS - Quick Start|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence/]), the stack gets created by the EC2 instances are not able to connect to the database after startup
h5. Steps to replicate
 # Create a Confluence 6+ stack
 # Complete setup wizard (might run into this issue: CONFSERVER-55825)
 # Manually create an RDS snapshot
 # Create ZIP backup of home folder
 # Shutdown instance and delete stack
 # Create new stack
 # In new stack form, add the RDS snapshot ID to restore
 ** (i) Stack creation completed without errors
 # Connect to EC2 instance, shutdown Confluence
 # Replace home folder under /var/atlassian/application-data/confluence
 # Restart Confluence
 ** (!) Right after restarting, we get an UnknownHostException:
{noformat}
2018-06-01 21:57:11,704 WARN [C3P0PooledConnectionPoolManager[identityToken->1bra4lh9v1gje3c51kw3yyl|7ead4f11]-HelperThread-#1] [mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool] log com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$ScatteredAcquireTask@7a7be9b5 -- Acquisition Attempt Failed!!! Clearing pending acquires. While trying to acquire a needed new resource, we failed to succeed more than the maximum number of allowed acquisition attempts (30). Last acquisition attempt exception: 
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: The connection attempt failed.
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.ConnectionFactoryImpl.openConnectionImpl(ConnectionFactoryImpl.java:272)
	at org.postgresql.core.ConnectionFactory.openConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:52)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgConnection.<init>(PgConnection.java:216)
	at org.postgresql.Driver.makeConnection(Driver.java:404)
	at org.postgresql.Driver.connect(Driver.java:272)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.DriverManagerDataSource.getConnection(DriverManagerDataSource.java:175)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.getPooledConnection(WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.java:220)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.getPooledConnection(WrapperConnectionPoolDataSource.java:206)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.C3P0PooledConnectionPool$1PooledConnectionResourcePoolManager.acquireResource(C3P0PooledConnectionPool.java:203)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.doAcquire(BasicResourcePool.java:1138)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.doAcquireAndDecrementPendingAcquiresWithinLockOnSuccess(BasicResourcePool.java:1125)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool.access$700(BasicResourcePool.java:44)
	at com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$ScatteredAcquireTask.run(BasicResourcePool.java:1870)
	at com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread.run(ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner.java:696)
Caused by: java.net.UnknownHostException: cd1emp97g39p5r.cwrfuau3dl2g.us-east-1.rds.amazonaws.com
{noformat}

h5. Expected results

Confluence starts up and we're able to log into the restored instance
h5. Actual results

Confluence throws a database connection error
h5. Workaround
 # *Fix*: Shutdown Confluence, point confluence.cfg.xml to RDS IP address
 # Restart Confluence

h5. Notes
 * Pointing to the IP address is not the best solution, so we should add away to allow the EC2 instances to resolve the hostname of the RDS instance that was restored from snapshot
 * Template taken from here (existing VPC): [Confluence Data Center on AWS - Quick Start|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence/]
 * Used Confluence 6.1.1 version to test
fields.summary: UnknownHostException when restoring from RDS snapshot using the CloudFormation Template

fields.description:
h5. Summary
There is a missing rule in the security group created by the CloudFormation template for the EC2 instances to connect to the RDS instance

h5. Steps to replicate
# Create a Confluence 6+ stack
# Complete setup wizard
# Wait for Confluence to connect to the database 

h5. Expected results
Confluence moves to the *Content* screen to complete setup

h5. Actual results
Confluence throws a database connection error

h5. Workaround
Manually edit the security group to add a rule to allow inbound traffic on port 5432, from the appropriate IP address

h5. Notes

* Main issue is that the template is not adding a rule to allow inbound connections on port 5432 (default PostgreSQL port) to the SG it creates
* Template taken from here (existing VPC): [Confluence Data Center on AWS - Quick Start|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/confluence/]
* Used Confluence 6.1.1 version
fields.summary: Missing Security Group rule in CloudFormation Template

fields.description:
h3. Summary When creating content from REST API, you are required to pass an ancestor ID to specify where this page is created h3. Steps to Reproduce # Login to Confluence # Create a new page *Test Page 1* # Get the ID of the page (you can edit the page and get it from the URL, or from the head section in the HTML source) # Delete *Test Page 1* # Don't clear the trash # Use the following CURL to create a page using REST API {code:borderStyle=solid} curl -u admin:admin -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"type":"page","title":"MySecondPage", "ancestors":[{"id":"11111112"}], "space":{"key":"TEST"},"body":{"storage":{"value":"

This is a new subpage

","representation":"storage"}}}' http://localhost:8090/confluence/rest/api/content/ | python -mjson.tool {code} h3. Expected Results The page should not be created and should tell the user that the ancestor page doesn't exist h3. Actual Results # Page is successfully created # Page is not visible in the page tree under the Space home # Page becomes a new root *next* to the Space home (!) *Please note that having multiple root pages will introduce a performance impact on content creation (from the UI as well as from the REST API)* h3.Workaround # The workaround is to restore the page *Test Page 1* from the trash and move both under the Space home. # Restore *Test Page 1* before creating the new page using REST API
fields.summary: Content creation using REST API should fail when ancestor page is in trash

fields.description:
Right now we only have SysV startup scripts. As most major Linux distributions now use systemd (not all), we should add these scripts. Filing as a bug and not suggestion because a user installing the binary on latest version of Linux will have broken functionality.

The current scripts do not contain LSB dependency info, which means Confluence may attempt to start before or at the same time as its database backend. It fails to access its database, and therefore fails to start.  [https://www.thegeekstuff.com/2012/03/lsbinit-script/] 

Note: Whoever handles this should likely just try and fix this for all products as the scripts would be very similar.
fields.summary: Add to KB: Fix outdated startup scripts in linux binary installer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Birthday and Custom Events not sending email notification to *Event Creator* even if the user is _Watching_ the Calendar and the Space

h3. Environment

Confluence 6.7.2
Team Calendar 6.0.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence with Team Calendar
 # Create a new Space
 # Visit the new Space and click on the *Calendars* button on the left sidebar
 # Click *Add Calendar* to add a New Calendar
 # *Watch* the newly created Calendar
 # *Watch* the Space that the new Calendar tied to
 # Add a *Birthdays* event or *Custom Event* with condition below:
 #* _Who_ field shouldn't be the creator
 # Log in to a different user and edit the event created above (eg: changing _Date_ or _What_ field)
 
h3. Expected Results
Email notification will be sent to the user that is _Watching_ the Space or Calendar

h3. Actual Results
No email notification is sent to *Birthdays* and *Custom Event* when another user has modified the events

h3. Note
Some other default events like below are receiving email notification:
* Travel
* Leave
* Events
fields.summary: Birthday and Custom Events not sending email notification to the Calendar Creator

h3. Summary

The Confluence: News gadget isn't working properly. Its icon is broken and its description is showing "_MSG_gadget.confluence.news.description_". The gadget also is not attached to the page, although the "insert" button appears.

h3. Environment
* Confluence with proxy
* Confluence without proxy

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page.
# Open the macro browser and select Other Macros.
# Search for "Confluence: News"

h3. Expected Results
Icon and description will load properly.

h3. Actual Results
Icon will be broken and its description will show "_MSG_gadget.confluence.news.description_". Nothing is stored in the logs.

h3.Workaround

This gadgets is [deprecated|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf615/end-of-support-announcements-for-confluence-967338804.html#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforConfluence-DeprecatedGadgetsinConfluence(12March2019)] from v7.0. So, upgrade to this or any of the recent versions.
fields.summary: Confluence: News gadget not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When there are several all-day events on a Calendar, the "hourly" portion of the calendar can become unusably small in the "Week" view, depending on the size of the browser window.
h3. Environment

Verified in Chrome and Firefox, using Team Calandars 6.0.12 on Confluence 6.8.0.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Team Calendars, create 4 or more all-day events with long descriptions
 # Select the "Week" view
 # Adjust the width of the window to various sizes

h3. Expected Results
 * At all window sizes, the calendar adjusts to show all data

h3. Actual Results
 * At a certain width, the "All day" section takes over, leaving the "hourly" portion just a few pixels tall.
 * The exact behavior and window size seems to vary based on the data shown in the calendar, but in the example below, the issue presented itself when the browser was between about 1500 and 2340 pixels wide:
 !calendar_bug_example.png|thumbnail!
 * At smaller sizes, the entire agenda block is scrollable, allowing you to scroll down to move up the "All day" portion and see more of the "Hourly" portion. When this bug is happening, however, the "All day" and "Hourly" section heights are fixed.

h3. Workaround

Adjust the window to a different size and refresh the page.
fields.summary: Team Calendars "Week" view unusable at certain window sizes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a \ backslash to escape a [ square bracket, the Markup has an incoherent behaviour.
h3. How to reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Click the + symbol at the toolbar
 # Select markup
 # type "\ [content\ ]"

h3. Expected results
 - The first square bracket is escaped and shown as normal text, without transforming the content between them into a link.

h3. Actual Results
 - The content in the same line as the \ [ is wrapped in a macro
 (i) If this is inside a table, two more columns will be added and the content will be between those, in other columns (i)

h3. Workaround
 - Avoid escaping the [ square bracket. Instead, escape only this ] square bracket. Escaping this ] square bracket (\ ]) at the same line, before escaping this [ square bracket (\ [) also avoids this issue
 - Use the ASCII equivalent codes for [ and ] , "&#91" for [ and "&#93" for ].

This does not happen when typing straight into the text editor.

Attached screenshots of this behaviour. There is no reference to this under [*Confluence Wiki Markup*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-wiki-markup-251003035.html]
fields.summary: Using \[ in Markup macro does not escape as expected

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Installing Confluence on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-confluence-on-linux-143556824.html] provides steps to install Confluence in the Linux operating system. It would be a good idea to add a section on known issues involving installing Confluence in CentOS and Redhat related to this bug (CONFSERVER-54067) and this KB [article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-ui-shows-garbled-or-corrupt-text-on-captcha-macros-and-or-diagrams-due-to-missing-fonts-938027858.html].

Typically, it is quite common for customers who are using the above environments to be facing issues related to garbled texts in various areas of their Confluence instance such as macros, preview documents, CAPTCHA and diagrams. This is due to the existence of lyx-fonts packages installed by default in the above environments. The work around of which is to uninstall these font packages.
fields.summary: Add a section in Confluence Linux installation guide to point out known issues related to lyx-fonts packages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Excel preview shows black screen in case the file contains specific type of hyperlink.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Attach  [^sample1.xlsx] to a page
# Preview the excel file

h3. Expected Results

The excel file is previewed correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The preview shows black screen.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

As far as I know, this bug can be reproduced in case that the hyperlink contains a round bracket "(". However, there seems to be more complicated rules.

* http://test/(   ←   This bug was reproduced. (/)
* http://test/(test).html   ←   This bug wasn't reproduced. (x)

h3.Workaround

Remove the problematic hyperlink from the excel file.
fields.summary: Excel preview shows black screen in case the file contains specific type of hyperlink

# Insert a PowerPoint macro.
# Try to preview the file with PowerPoint macro.

The file will be displayed as it is displayed in Microsoft Office Suite.

h3. Actual Results
All 3D objects are turned into plain objects.

h3.Workaround
No workarounds.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking on the *Create Meeting Notes* button in a space that has a space key that starts with "0" causes prompts a dialog box with the infinite spinning wheel and nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space with a space key that starts with 0
# In that space create a new page from a template and choose *Meeting Notes*
# This will direct you to a new meeting note page in Edit mode. Click Publish.
# From the side bar, under Page Tree click *Meeting notes*
# In the meeting notes UI, click *Create Meeting Notes*

!Screen Shot 2018-05-30 at 2.59.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
New meeting Notes in Edit mode is displayed. 

h3. Actual Results
A dialog box with infinite loading loop is shown. 

!Screen Shot 2018-05-30 at 3.13.08 PM.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
This issue has similar behavior as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-45606, however, trying to replicate the issue as described in the bug using the steps was not successful in this version of Confluence.

h3.Workaround
Right clicking the *Create Meeting Notes* and selecting open in new tab will open the page in a new tab with no issues.
fields.summary: Unable to Create Meeting Notes in Spaces that has a key starting with "0"

fields.description:
Daily summary plugin (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-daily-summary-email) fails with NPE when it tries to generate email consisting of content created by author with default avatar. The reason for this is that our image decoding library uses {{ImageIO.read}} method, which can't process SVG images. Default avatars have SVG format, so they always fail email generation.

To reproduce, simply try to generate summary email containing pages from authors with default avatar.
fields.summary: Daily summary plugin fails on authors with default avatar

fields.description:
The notes section of this documentation [Configuring Synchrony for Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-synchrony-for-data-center-858772125.html#ConfiguringSynchronyforDataCenter-Notes] mentions enabling XHR fallback if WebSocket is not configured.
However, it does not mention the impact on using XHR instead of WebSocket. What are the performance implications or bottlenecks that might arise if customers are not using WebSocket? What will be the user impact on the Collaborative Editing feature?
fields.summary: Improve Synchrony documentation - Impact of XHR vs WebSocket

fields.description:
h4. Summary/Expected Result
According to [Archive a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/archive-a-space-724764817.html], If a space is archived, that space and it's contents won't appear on any dropdown menus, including the *Confluence quick navigation*, which drops down when you enter text in the search box.

h4. Actual Result
Pages from an archived space still appear in quick nav 

h4. Steps to replicate
# Create space A
# Create space B
# Create page 'ABC' in space A
# Create page 'DEF' in space B
# Archive space B
# Search for 'ABC'
#* ABC now appears in quick nav
# Search for DEF (with the "Search archived spaces" tag enabled)
#* DEF now appears in quick nav

h4. Note
This behavior is similar to [CONFSERVER-36344 - Archived Space and page appears in quick nav for members of the confluence-administrators group|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36344] but this also affects non-Confluence admin.
fields.summary: Archived Space and page appears in quick nav

fields.description:
When adding a new user and letting them set the password themselves, the email that Confluence sends out is extremely misleading as to which link to click.

I had numerous users get into an endless cycle resetting their password over and over again, because the click on the "/forgotuserpassword.action" link (1) instead of on the "Reset password" button (2). Comment from the last user I helped to figure it out was "Ahh, those two do not do the same...?".

!image-2018-05-28-20-53-44-304.png!
fields.summary: Misleading password reset email

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Collaborative Editing takes an unfeasible amount of time to enable if the database holds a high number of *stale drafts*.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6+ 
* DC or Standalone
* Reproduced with 20k stale drafts

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Confluence
# Start Synchrony
# Go to the Collaborative Editing management page
# Attempt to enable CE

h3. Expected Results

Collaborative Editing is enabled in a few seconds.

h3. Actual Results

The *Change Mode* popup keeps spinning and the task is not completed:
 !changemode.png|thumbnail!

Depending on the number of Stale Drafts, this task can take hours to complete or even fail.

h3. Notes

If you take thread dumps while CE is being enabled, we can see that the *Remove Stale Drafts* task is ongoing. This class can be spotted on the threads:

{code}
at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.removeStaleSharedDrafts(DefaultPageManager.java:775)
{code}

So, the problem is caused by the inefficiency of the *removeStaleSharedDrafts* task.

h3. Log Sample
{code:borderStyle=solid}
ERROR [Long running task: EnableTask] [springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate] rollbackOnException Application exception overridden by rollback exception
 -- url: /rest/synchrony-interop/enable | referer: https://confluence.example.com/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action | traceId: 3764f927fd378bc8 | userName: admin
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Session/EntityManager is closed
	...
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.removeStaleSharedDrafts(DefaultPageManager.java:764)
	...
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2201.removeStaleSharedDrafts(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.tasks.EnableTask.execute(EnableTask.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.tasks.AbstractConfigLongRunningTask.runInternal(AbstractConfigLongRunningTask.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.run(ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.longrunning.ManagedTask.run(ManagedTask.java:52)
{code}

h3.Workaround

Follow the KB below in order to manually remove the staled drafts:

* [How to manually remove Stale Drafts from Confluence Database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+manually+remove+Stale+Drafts+from+Confluence+Database]
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing takes an unfeasible amount of time to enable if a high number of stale drafts exist on the DB

fields.description: For easier managing of applications, it would be beneficial to have an option to subscribe for notifications for new entries in Audit Logs.
fields.summary: Notification of all notifications from audit logs.

fields.description:
h3. Description
As a confluence admin, the user can view and access any page in confluence. However, if the confluence admin is watching a space or page in confluence and does not have the view space permission for that space. The confluence admin will not receive an email notification when other user edited the page. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Login in as a normal user
# Create a confluence space
# Ensure that confluence admin does not have any permission for that space. (make sure confluence admin group is not included as well)
# Create a new page in the space
# Add the confluence admin user as a watcher of the page
# Edit the page

h3. Actual Result
The confluence admin do not receive any notification from that space

h3. Expected Result
The confluence admin will receive notification from that space as the confluence admin is watching the page/space and also able to view the space/page with admin rights.
fields.summary: confluence admin is able to view the page but not getting page edit/create notification when the confluence admin is not granted the view space permission in space permission page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when deleting a parent page with child pages under it, there is an option to *Delete All* child pages, starting with Confluence 6.0.1, as implemented in [CONFSERVER-5974|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5974]

h3. Suggested Solution
A better behaviour would be the ability to select individual child pages via checkbox to delete them selectively and not all at once, similar to options given for page/space export.
fields.summary: Need ability to selectively delete child pages

Currently there are a few accessibility issues with the templates for this plugin, it is missing some accessibility code:
 * page-banner.js (and page-banner-min.js)

 * page-banner.soy
 Add aria-label, and default href attribute to "a" tag

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition

Currently there are a few accessibility issues with the templates for this plugin, for example it is missing some accessibility code:
